file_system package

file_system.utils module

file_system.utils.append_to_filename(file_path, append_text)[source]

Appends text to the filename of the given file path.

Parameters:

  • file_path – The file path.

  • append_text – The text to append to the filename.

Returns:

The modified file path with appended text.

file_system.utils.file_exists(file_path)[source]

Checks if the given file path exists.

Parameters:

file_path – The path to check.

Returns:

True if the path exists, False otherwise.

file_system.utils.get_all_files(dir, recursive=False)[source]

Returns a list of all files in the given directory.

Parameters:

  • dir – The directory path.

  • recursive – If True, includes subdirectories.

Returns:

A list of file paths.

file_system.utils.get_all_files_with_ext(path, ext)[source]

Returns a list of all files with a specific extension in the given directory.

Parameters:

  • path – The directory path.

  • ext – The file extension.

Returns:

A list of file paths with the specified extension.

file_system.utils.get_extension(file_path)[source]

Returns the extension of the given file path.

Parameters:

file_path – The file path.

Returns:

The file extension (without the dot).

file_system.utils.get_filename(file_path)[source]

Returns the filename without the extension from the given file path.

Parameters:

file_path – The file path.

Returns:

The filename without the extension.

file_system.utils.get_folder(file_path)[source]

Returns the directory containing the given file path.

Parameters:

file_path – The file path.

Returns:

The directory of the file path.

file_system.utils.in_downloads(file_path='')[source]

Returns the path to a file within the download directory.

Parameters:

file_path – The relative path to the file within the download directory.

Returns:

The full path to the file.

file_system.utils.in_working(file_path='')[source]

Returns the path to a file within the working directory.

Parameters:

file_path – The relative path to the file within the working directory.

Returns:

The full path to the file.

file_system.utils.is_dir(file_path='')[source]

Checks if the given file path is a directory.

Parameters:

file_path – The path to check.

Returns:

True if the path is a directory, False otherwise.

file_system.utils.load_json_from_file(json_file)[source]

Loads and returns the data from a JSON file.

Parameters:

json_file – The path to the JSON file.

Returns:

The data loaded from the JSON file.

file_system.utils.mkdir(file_path)[source]

Creates a directory if it does not already exist.

Parameters:

file_path – The path of the directory to create.

file_system.utils.tidy_json_file(file_path)[source]

Tidies a single JSON file by formatting it with proper indentation.

Parameters:

file_path – The path to the JSON file.

file_system.utils.tidy_json_files(path)[source]

Tidies all JSON files in the given directory by formatting them with proper indentation.

Parameters:

path – The directory path.

file_system.utils.tidy_text_files(path)[source]

Tidies all text files in the given directory by removing escape characters.

Parameters:

path – The directory path.

file_system.utils.unzip(path, recursive=False, delete=False)[source]

Unzips a file to a specified directory and optionally deletes the original zip file.

Parameters:

  • path – The path to the zip file.

  • recursive – If True, recursively unzips any subfiles that may be zipped.

  • delete – If True, deletes the original zip file after extraction.
